In Julia, Write a pig latin transformer called `pig_latinify` that operates on a vector of strings. It iterates over each string and changes it to pig latin. Each iteration should run on a separate thread.

Here is a Julia implementation of a pig latinify function that runs each string transformation on a separate thread:

```julia
function pig_latinify(words::Vector{String})
    out = String[]
    Threads.@threads for word in words
        latin_word = piglatin(word)
        push!(out, latin_word)
    end
    return out
end

function piglatin(word::String)
    if startswith(word, consonant)
        return string(word[2:end], word[1], "ay")
    else
        return string(word, "way")
    end
end

const vowels = ["a","e","i","o","u"]
consonant(c::Char) = !(c in vowels)
```

To use it:

```julia
words = ["hello", "world", "julia"]
pig_latin_words = pig_latinify(words) 
```

This runs `piglatin` on each string in `words` in a separate thread, transforming each to pig latin and collecting the output.
